result.execSummary:
The defendant Herman Hampton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Herman Hampton in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Herman Hampton in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 173 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME. 

The court objects to electronic monitoring. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and restitution in the amount of $599.98 to Target by 9/28/2018, or serve 20 days in the House of Correction.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Siefert 
for review. os

Received from the Department of Corrections - Probation, request to:
[    ]   Extend Probation
[    ]   Set Restitution
[    ]   Remove Court Obligations
[    ]   Review / Modify Probation
[    ]   Convert Unpaid Obligations to Civil Judgment
( X )  Sentence After Revocation

Sentencing proceeded COUNT TWO: 

Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for ZERO DAYS time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for TWO YEARS with the following conditions:
*aoda/treatment
*no new retail theft ticket
*no contact with Target
*restitution in the amount of $599.98 to Target during term of probation or civil judgment shall be entered agains the defendant
*court ordered costs, fees and surcharges to be paid during term of probation or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.
Court will consider early termination of probation if defendant performs additional community service.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Herman Hampton in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded as to Count ONE: 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.  Court stayed the commencment until 9-25-15.  

 Fine of $300.00 including all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges to be paid FORTHWITH or revocation of huber privileges.

Defendant Herman Hampton in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Counts One and Two: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  

ON motion of the State, Count Three:  Dismissed and read in as to sentencing. 

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. lr  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Herman Hampton in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-30-2015 at 08:30 am.

  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Oral No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Target Stores

Defendant Herman Hampton in court.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.47  for a Pretrial Conference.vb
